questions.question: What is the normal blood pressure range for an adult?
questions.explanation: Normal adult blood pressure is considered to be between 90/60 and 120/80 mmHg.

questions.question: Which of the following is a common side effect of diuretics?
questions.explanation: Diuretics are known to cause low potassium levels (hypokalemia).

questions.question: A patient is prescribed a medication that could cause dizziness. What should be advised?
answers: Take it with lots of water
questions.explanation: Patients should be advised to avoid sudden changes in position to prevent falls due to dizziness.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of the NCLEX?
answers: To serve as a licensing requirement for nurses
To provide a comprehensive assessment of a candidate's nursing knowledge and skills
To certify a nurse’s ability to administer medications safely
questions.explanation: Correct! The NCLEX assesses nursing knowledge and skills to ensure safe practice. For more details, review the NCLEX Overview & Strategies guide.

questions.question: Which question type is NOT featured on the NCLEX?
questions.explanation: Essay questions are not part of the NCLEX format. For further details, check the NCLEX Overview & Strategies guide.

questions.question: What is a common side effect of opioids in pharmacology?
questions.explanation: Opioids can cause respiratory depression. Review the Pharmacology Essentials for the NCLEX for more details.

questions.question: Which patient assessment parameter is most critical when administering beta-blockers?
questions.explanation: Beta-blockers require close monitoring of heart rate. See the Medical-Surgical Nursing Essentials guide for more context.

questions.question: What is a key intervention during prenatal care?
questions.explanation: Folic acid supplementation is crucial in prenatal care. For more information, check the Maternal-Child Nursing Essentials guide.

questions.question: What is a primary goal of therapeutic communication in mental health nursing?
questions.explanation: Therapeutic communication focuses on building trust with patients. Learn more in the Mental Health Nursing Essentials guide.

questions.question: Which condition is characterized by the presence of endometrial tissue outside the uterus?
questions.explanation: Endometriosis is defined by the presence of endometrial tissue outside the uterus. Refer to the Obstetric‑Gynecological Nursing Essentials guide for more details.

questions.question: What is a primary focus when developing patient care plans in Medical-Surgical Nursing?
answers: Creating detailed medication and monitoring plans
questions.explanation: Developing detailed care plans is crucial for effective patient management. Learn more in the Medical-Surgical Nursing Essentials guide.

questions.question: Which strategy is recommended for managing time during the NCLEX?
questions.explanation: Using a timer can help you allocate your exam time efficiently. More strategies can be found in the NCLEX Overview & Strategies guide.

questions.question: Which suffix is common among ACE Inhibitors?
questions.explanation: ACE Inhibitors typically end with -pril. For further details, see the Pharmacology Essentials for the NCLEX guide.

questions.question: What is a key focus during labor and delivery management in maternal-child nursing?
answers: Administering high doses of pain medication
questions.explanation: Monitoring fetal heart rate is essential during labor and delivery. Refer to the Maternal-Child Nursing Essentials guide for more information.

questions.question: Which disorder is characterized by fluctuations between depressive and manic episodes?
questions.explanation: Bipolar Disorder involves swings between depressive and manic states. Read more in the Mental Health Nursing Essentials guide.
